Class Hand

  • java.lang.Object
    • Hand

  • public class Hand
extends java.lang.Object
    Hand is a list of 13 card objects, used by any human or bot, it contains methods to check the status and manipulate the cards in the hand.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Hand()
      creates a new array list that can store Card objects.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(Card card)
      Adds a card object to the hand and sorts the hand as the card is added
      boolean contains(Card c)
      checks to see if a certain card is in the hand.
      Card getCardAtPosition(int position)
      Returns a card at a specific position in the hand using arrayList's get method
      int getNumSpades()
      The method getNumSpades is necessary in the game Spades because the number of spades in your hand right away is the number of bids or "wins" you must try to get in that round.
      boolean remove(Card card)
      Removes a specific card object from the hand using arrayList's remove method
      Card remove(int position)
      Removes a card object from the hand, based on position using arrayList's methods
      int size()
      Returns the number of cards in the hand
      java.lang.String toString()
      Prints out every card in the hand and the size of the hand

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

      • add

        public void add(Card card)
        Adds a card object to the hand and sorts the hand as the card is added
        Parameters:

      • remove

        public boolean remove(Card card)
        Removes a specific card object from the hand using arrayList's remove method
        Parameters:
        card - Card to be removed from the hand.
        Returns:
        true if Card is successfully removed, false otherwise

      • remove

        public Card remove(int position)
        Removes a card object from the hand, based on position using arrayList's methods
        Parameters:
        position - The position to be removed from the array list
        Returns:
        The Card that is removed

      • getCardAtPosition

        public Card getCardAtPosition(int position)
        Returns a card at a specific position in the hand using arrayList's get method
        Parameters:
        position - The position to be returned from the hand
        Returns:
        The card at the given position

      • getNumSpades

        public int getNumSpades()
        The method getNumSpades is necessary in the game Spades because the number of spades in your hand right away is the number of bids or "wins" you must try to get in that round.
        Returns:
        The number of spades in the hand

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Prints out every card in the hand and the size of the hand
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • contains

        public boolean contains(Card c)
        checks to see if a certain card is in the hand.
        Parameters:
        c - The card to check.
        Returns:
        True if it is in the hand, else false.

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the number of cards in the hand
        Returns:
        an integer 0-13 the is the number of cards in the hand
